jettison.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to get rid of something or decide not to do something any longer
jettison.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The scheme was jettisoned when the government found it too costly.
jettison.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to throw things away, especially from a moving plane or ship
jettison.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to get rid of something quickly or completely because it is not good enough
jettison.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Some Wall Street firms will jettison unprofitable businesses.
